info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 8:25AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Beware of High Stream Levels... Water levels across the Lynchburg Area are high. Many streams are near bankfull and should be avoided today, including the James River from Lynchburg to Bremo Bluff. Recreationalists are encouraged to avoid water activities which involve tubing, boating, or fishing for any local streams withing Bedford, Campbell, Amherst, Appomattox, and Buckingham counties. The water levels within these counties are expected to remain above normal throughout the day with the potential for debris to be washed into the river channels resulting in hazardous conditions. River banks will be soft and muddy and may give way, so please avoid going near the waters edge until water levels have receded. Rainfall totals during the last 24 hours ranged between 2 to 5 inches along the Highway 29 corridor from Lynchburg to Charlottesville and also along the Highway 460 corridor from Lynchburg to Farmville. Some additional rainfall is possible this morning, but amounts are expected to be lighter in comparison to what fell Saturday evening. The rain is expected to gradually come to an end by noon today. Again, for your safety, please avoid streams and rivers today. In addition, please use caution on area roads and adhere to any road closures due to high water.
